newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Intel off sharply.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Intel off sharply.

text.p: Shares of Intel Corp sank in U.S. pre-opening trade on Friday after the giant chipmaker warned that second-quarter results would be below its earlier expectations.
Shares were trading at 146-1/2, off from the close on Thursday of 163-49/64, according to traders. The stock was continuing to move lower, with some trades at 145-1/2.
"The news surprised everybody," said one trader, who said that many major technology shares were also getting hit along with Intel.

Microsoft Corp traded at 123, down from the close of 125-7/8, and Dell Computer Corp was selling at 107, off from the close of 110-3/8. Shares of International Business Machines Corp dropped, to 83 from the close of 87-7/8.
"They are all trading down off the Intel numbers," said another trader.
Intel said revenues and net income for its fiscal second quarter will fall below company's expectations due to weaker-than-expected demand, particularly in Europe.
Revenue for the period was expected to drop five to 10 percent below the first quarter's $6.4 billion while the gross margin is forecast to come under the 64 percent in the prior period, Intel said.
